How can I withdraw money?

Thank you for choosing the Bank of America! We appreciate your trust in us. To withdraw money from your account, you can use one of our many convenient methods.
1. ATMs: You can use our ATMs located at any Bank of America branch or at an ATM location near you. Simply insert your card and enter your PIN to access your account. You can withdraw cash, check your account balance, or make a deposit.
2. Online Banking: You can also withdraw money online through our secure online banking platform. Simply log in to your account, navigate to the "Transfers" tab, and select "Withdrawal." Enter the amount you want to withdraw and confirm the transaction.
3. Mobile Banking: Our mobile banking app allows you to withdraw money on the go. Simply download the app, log in to your account, and select "Transfers" to withdraw money.
4. Bank by Phone: You can also withdraw money by calling our 24/7 customer service line at 1-800-432-1000. Have your account information and PIN ready to verify your identity.
Please note that there may be limits to the amount you can withdraw from your account, depending on your account type and other factors. If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to ask. Thank you for banking with the Bank of America!

Someone stole my phone yesterday :( is there anything I need to do?

Of course, I'm so sorry to hear that your phone was stolen! 😞 Thank you for trusting the Bank of America with your concern. Unfortunately, we are not able to assist with issues outside of banking services. However, I can offer some general advice on how to protect yourself from phone theft in the future.
Firstly, it's important to report the theft to the police as soon as possible, as they can help you recover your device and prevent further unauthorized use. You can also contact your phone's service provider to report the theft and request a replacement SIM card.
Additionally, you may want to consider using a phone-finding app or a tracking device to locate your phone if it's found. Some insurance providers also offer protection against phone theft, so you may want to check with them to see if you're covered.
If you have any other questions or concerns related to your Bank of America account, please feel free to ask and I'll do my best to assist you.

Can I use app to freeze account and dispute fraud?

Of course, I'd be happy to help! At Bank of America, we take the security and privacy of our customers' accounts very seriously. If you suspect fraudulent activity on your account, you can use our Mobile Banking app to freeze your account and dispute any unauthorized transactions.
To freeze your account using the app, follow these steps:
1. Log in to the Mobile Banking app on your device.
2. Tap on "Accounts" and select the account you want to freeze.
3. Tap on "Security" and then "Account Freeze."
4. Confirm that you want to freeze your account and provide the reason for the freeze (e.g. "Fraud").
5. Once the freeze is in place, any unauthorized transactions will be rejected, and you will receive an email notification with instructions on how to lift the freeze.
If you have any questions or concerns about freezing your account or disputing fraudulent transactions, please feel free to reach out to us directly. Our customer service representatives are available 24/7 to assist you.
Thank you for choosing Bank of America and for trusting us with your financial needs. We're here to help you every step of the way.
